findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unsecured approve function
findings.description: The approve function allows unlimited token approval without proper validation or access control.

findings.title: Unsecured transfer function
findings.description: The smart contract contains unsecured transfer functions that can be exploited to impose extraordinary transaction fees.

findings.title: Unsecured transferFrom function
findings.description: The transferFrom function is vulnerable to unauthorized token transfers.

findings.title: Unsecured increaseAllowance function
findings.description: The increaseAllowance function lacks proper security measures.

findings.title: Unsecured decreaseAllowance function
findings.description: The decreaseAllowance function is unsecured and can potentially lead to unauthorized allowance changes.

findings.title: Unsecured deliver function
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unsecured excludeFromReward function
findings.description: The excludeFromReward function is public and can be called by anyone, potentially allowing unauthorized access to sensitive functionality.

findings.title: Unsecured includeInReward function
findings.description: The includeInReward function is public and can be called by anyone, potentially allowing unauthorized access to reward mechanisms.

findings.title: Unsecured _approve function
findings.description: The _approve function lacks proper security measures, potentially leading to unauthorized access or manipulation.

findings.title: Unsecured _transfer function
findings.description: The _transfer function is unsecured and can be exploited by malicious actors.

findings.title: Unsecured swapTokens function
findings.description: The swapTokens function is unsecured and can be exploited by unauthorized users.

findings.title: Unsecured buyBackTokens function
findings.description: The smart contract owner can buyback tokens from the total supply without any arbitrary limit set.

findings.title: Unsecured swapTokensForEth function
findings.description: The swapTokensForEth function is unsecured and can be exploited by malicious actors.

findings.title: Unsecured swapETHForTokens function
findings.description: The swapETHForTokens function is unsecured and can be exploited by malicious users.

findings.title: Unsecured addLiquidity function
findings.description: The addLiquidity function lacks proper security measures.

findings.title: Unsecured _tokenTransfer function
findings.description: The _tokenTransfer function is unsecured and can be exploited by non-whitelisted wallets to transfer a specified number of tokens.

findings.title: Unsecured _transferStandard function
findings.description: The `_transferStandard` function is private and lacks proper access control, potentially allowing unauthorized transactions.

findings.title: Unsecured permit function
findings.description: The permit function allows unauthorized access to sensitive operations.

findings.title: Unsecured burn function
findings.description: The burn function does not have proper access control or validation, allowing unauthorized users to drain the contract's funds.

findings.title: Unsecured swap function
findings.description: The swap functions are unsecured, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of token amounts.

findings.title: Unsecured skim function
findings.description: The skim function is unsecured and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Unsecured sync function
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unsecured initialize function
findings.description: The initialize function is unsecured, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of the contract's state.
